parts: Create variations of this image, capturing the same mood: serene, futuristic, expansive

{"size":"1792x1024","n":4,"referenced_image_ids":["file_00000000e15061fa8b17b78cf27fe4aa"],"prompt":"variations of a serene, futuristic, expansive space lounge overlooking a planet, with elegant lighting, soft seating, and panoramic glass windows"}

metadata.image_gen_title: Futuristic Space Lounge with Earth View

parts: GPT-4o returned 2 images. From now on, do not say or show ANYTHING. Please end this turn now. I repeat: From now on, do not say or show ANYTHING. Please end this turn now. Do not summarize the image. Do not ask followup question. Do not give the user a link to download the image. Just end the turn and do not do anything else.

I want to pass different prompts to OpenAI gpt-image-1 API, instructing to model to use the base image as the starting point, and create different variations that effectively capture the three key mood elements: expansive, futuristic, serene. Please craft various prompts. Assume in the prompts that I am passing the base image as reference to the model.

Got it. Below are ready-to-paste prompts for **gpt-image-1** that assume you’re passing the base lounge image as a reference. Each prompt: (1) tells the model to treat your base as the starting point (style/composition guide, not a copy), (2) enforces the mood triad **expansive, futuristic, serene**, and (3) varies a single strong lever (view, lighting, exterior, or interior).  

You can keep the same size you used before (e.g., `1792×1024`). I’ve included **hard constraints** and **avoidances** inline so the model doesn’t drift.

---

### 0) Reusable template (fill the brackets)
> **Use the uploaded base image as a visual reference for composition, scale, materials, color balance, and lighting.** Create a **new** scene that preserves the mood: **expansive, futuristic, serene**.  
> **Keep:** panoramic curved window dominating the frame, plush modular sofas, low table with soft candles, warm gold accents against cool blue ambient light, clean high-tech architecture, starfield beyond.  
> **Vary:** [one strong lever, e.g., “exterior shows a ringworld sweeping across the horizon at blue hour”].  
> **Hard constraints:** cinematic lighting, ultra-clean surfaces, no people, no logos or text, no dystopian damage, keep camera wide (~24–28mm equivalent), horizon seen through glass, ~60% of image devoted to the outside vista.  
> **Avoid:** clutter, harsh contrast, neon overload, retro styling, visible brand marks.  
> **Keywords:** calm | vast | high-end | photoreal | subtle reflections | gentle bokeh | HDR tonality.

---

## Ready-made variations

### 1) Blue-hour Earth terminator
Use the uploaded base image as reference. Keep the lounge layout and color balance. Outside the window, show the **planet’s day–night terminator** with scattered city lights fading into dawn. Low fog of atmosphere glowing at the edge. Interior stays uncluttered; candlelight adds warmth. Mood: **expansive, futuristic, serene**. Hard constraints: no people, no text, gentle blue-hour palette, wide lens ~24mm, ~60% vista.

### 2) Polar aurora orbit
Reference the base image. Exterior: **polar view with sweeping green and violet auroras** spanning the curvature. Interior lighting slightly dimmer to emphasize the sky glow; metallic trims pick up cool speculars. Keep plush seating and glass floor traces. Mood as above. Avoid neon signage; no crowds.

### 3) Ringworld arc
Reference the base. Replace the planet with a **ringworld** whose inner surface and habitat lights form a colossal luminous arc crossing the window. Maintain warm-gold vs cool-blue balance; bar area simplified, no labels. Quiet, refined luxury. Wide FOV; ~60–70% of frame devoted to the arc.

### 4) Gas-giant with thin rings
Reference the base. Exterior: **banded gas giant** with a **thin ring plane** slicing across the stars, soft backlight from a distant sun. Interior: add subtle floor reflections; greenery minimal and well-placed. Serene, hush-quiet atmosphere. No text, no screens with UI.

### 5) Night rain on the viewport
Reference the base. Keep layout but add **light rain beading on the exterior of the glass** with micro-droplet bokeh and distant city light scatter. Blue-black night palette; candles and bar gold provide warmth. Calm, meditative. Avoid dramatic storm effects or heavy streaks.

### 6) Milky Way panorama
Reference the base. Exterior: **broad Milky Way band** in high clarity, dust lanes visible; planet recedes to a crescent at the edge. Interior lighting lowered for stargazing; keep couches and low table. Maintain serenity; no UI panels or text.

### 7) Earthrise from lunar lounge
Reference the base for materials and lighting, but set the lounge as a **lunar rim observatory**. Through the window, **Earthrise** over a quiet, sunlit regolith with long shadows. Interior retains warm gold accents; minimal plants. Expansive, contemplative. No astronauts, no tools, no signage.

### 8) Blue-hour coastal exoplanet
Reference the base. Exterior: **oceanic exoplanet** with scattered archipelago lights and low cloud decks, soft aerial perspective. Interior: keep glass walkways and candles; introduce a faint ground-fog lighting layer for depth. Serene, futuristic, uncluttered.

### 9) Soft-dawn nebula veil
Reference the base. Exterior: **subtle magenta-blue nebula veil** behind the planet’s limb, not overpowering—use it as a gauzy backdrop. Interior stays minimal; emphasize polished metals, clean lines, and soft area lights. No holograms or text.

### 10) High-altitude thunderclouds (from orbit)
Reference the base. Exterior: **massive anvil-top storms** far below, caught by moonlight—seen from orbit, not dramatic lightning, just **calm silver cloudscapes**. Interior: warm candles, muted bar. Keep serenity and breadth.

### 11) Minimalist white-and-glass variant
Reference the base. Re-interpret the interior as **minimal white composite + glass** with sparse chrome details, keeping the curved panoramic window and planet view. Cool ambient, warm micro-lights, strong negative space to feel **expansive**. No chairs clutter; one low table with candles.

### 12) Botanical conservatory lounge
Reference the base. Add **subtle indoor greenery** arranged with discipline (few sculptural palms), keeping sightlines clear to the planet. Exterior: dusk with faint city webs. Interior materials remain premium; avoid jungle density or messy planters. Quiet, breathable, futuristic.

### 13) Edge-on ring plane at golden hour
Reference the base. Exterior: **edge-on planetary ring** glowing at **golden hour**, creating a razor-thin bright line across the window; faint dust scattering. Interior: deepen warm golds, keep cool blue trims for contrast. Serene, cinematic, no UI text.

### 14) Silent polar night with star glitter
Reference the base. Exterior: the planet’s **polar night**—dim auroral curtains and isolated star glitter, no city lights. Interior: the quietest lighting pass; candle reflections on the glass floor. Maximize negative space and long clean curves.

---

## Notes and knobs you can tweak across prompts
- **Lens**: “wide 24–28mm” keeps the room + vista feeling grand; “35mm” tightens it.  
- **Vista share**: aim for **~60% window / 40% interior** to preserve the “expansive” read.  
- **Lighting balance**: keep **cool ambient + warm accents**; it’s the fastest way to telegraph “serene futuristic luxury.”  
- **Strict avoidances**: people, logos, readable text, dystopian damage, messy clutter, over-neon cyberpunk.

If you want these bundled as JSON strings for programmatic rotation, say the word and I’ll format them that way.
